newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: Bank sees S.Lankan stock market gaining further.
newsitem.headline: Bank sees S.Lankan stock market gaining further.

text.p: Sri Lanka's stock market has emerged from its recent bear phase and the benchmark share index should gain at least another 3.7 percent by the end of the year, a report by the Bank of Ceylon said.

The report, received by Reuters on Wednesday, said daily turnover in foreign and local shares on the Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) had risen by between 20 and 60 percent year-on-year in the January to May period.
The CSE All Share Index stood just below 820 points at noon on July 16, after starting the year at 607. The index peaked at 1,378 in March 1994.
The market fell sharply in 1996 when corporate earnigns were hit by power cuts due to a severe drought.
"The stock market performance will improve further during the year," the bank report said. "The CSE index will pass the 850 mark by the year-end."
